conclusion: Understand how the position and size of shadows change when the light source moves to the right.
Object C is the chicken leg.
Shadow A is cast by the birdcage.
Shadow B is cast by the skull.
Shadow C is cast by the chicken leg.
Effect of moving the light source to the right changes direction of light rays affecting position and size of shadows.
Shadows will shift to the left as the light source moves to the right.
Size of shadows depends on distance of objects from new light source; closer objects have smaller shadows, farther objects have larger shadows.
Birdcage's shadow will move to the left and may become smaller if farther from the new light source.
Skull's shadow will move to the left and may become smaller if farther from the new light source.
Chicken leg's shadow will move to the left and may become smaller if farther from the new light source.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, and C will move to the left and may become smaller depending on distance from the new light source.
